title: 2024 US election: Harris and Trump to debate in key TV moment for a tight race
summary: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump are due to face off on ABC on Tuesday. The vice president, whose profile is still unclear for some Americans, will try to win over undecided and moderate conservative voters.

title: Nestlé to pay 2 million euros to close France water probes
summary: The deal ends preliminary probes into the use of wells without authorization and fraud for filtering its mineral waters, a practice that is illegal in France where mineral waters are supposed to be natural.

title: Protesters invade Mexican Senate to halt judicial reform debate
summary: The crowds of protesters forced lawmakers to suspend a debate on the judicial reform plan on Tuesday. The proposal, which experts say would make Mexico the world's only country to elect all judges, has sparked mass demonstrations, diplomatic tensions and investor jitters.

title: In East Timor, a young Catholic country welcomes Pope Francis with jubilation
summary: Francis' third stop in Southeast Asia, the former Portuguese and then Indonesian colony, whose population is 97% Catholic, came to a standstill for three days to celebrate the arrival of the head of the Church.

title: Vladimir Kara-Murza, Russian opponent: 'We need to prepare for the post-Putin era'
summary: The Russian opponent, who successively met Joe Biden, Olaf Scholz and, on Monday September 9, Emmanuel Macron, calls on heads of state to recognize and work with the 'other Russia' opposed to the war.

title: France's first lady Brigitte Macron makes cameo in new 'Emily in Paris' episode
summary: The idea of the cameo emerged after the series' creator Darren Star and the show's star Lily Collins met Emmanuel Macron's wife at the Elysée Palace in December 2022, Elle magazine revealed. The second half of the fourth season is being released Thursday on Netflix.

title: Israel strikes Gaza humanitarian zone
summary: The Israeli army said it carried out the strikes on the Al-Mawasi camp in Khan Yunis to target 'significant' members of Hamas.

title: Palestinians take new seat at UN General Assembly
summary: Starting with the 79th General Assembly session, which began Tuesday, the Palestinians can submit proposals and amendments, and sit among member states. These new rights were granted to the Palestinian delegation in a resolution adopted in May.

title: EU top court delivers 'big win' against Apple and Google
summary: In two back-to-back rulings, the European Court of Justice gave the Union's regulators two major victories in their ongoing battles with tech giants, judging that Apple and Google must pay over €15 billion in total.

title: ECB accused of stifling growth in Europe
summary: The European Central Bank may cut interest rates at its meeting on Thursday. But is the move coming too late and too slow?

title: US unveils sanctions against Iran after missiles delivery to Russia
summary: The decision comes after the UK, France and Germany already announced sanctions against Iran earlier on Tuesday.

title: French mass rape trial: Pelicot will be back in court to testify on Wednesday
summary: Dominique Pelicot, accused of drugging his wife to repeatedly rape her and enabling dozens of other men to rape her, initially withdrew from the trial on medical reasons on Monday.

title: Algerian presidential candidate appeals election result
summary: Three days after Algeria's presidential election, opposition candidate Abdelaali Hassani, head of the Movement of Society for Peace party, filed an official appeal, citing 'false figures' and widely contested turnout rates.

title: Russia ups arrests, imprisonment of its generals
summary: At least 10 generals and defense officials have been detained or prosecuted in fraud and corruption cases in recent months, against the backdrop of an upcoming appointment as the head of the security services (FSB).

title: France, Germany and UK issue new sanctions over Iran's missile deliveries to Russia
summary: The European Union on Monday announced that its allies had shared intelligence that Iran had supplied Russia with ballistic missiles, and warned of new sanctions on Tehran.

title: Mario Draghi's competitiveness report: EU condemned to 'slow agony' if no change
summary: In a 400-page report, the former ECB president analyzes why the EU is lagging behind the US and China, and calls for more joint borrowing and investment.

title: Vincent Labrune re-elected head of France's football league
summary: Vincent Labrune was re-elected president of France's football league on Tuesday. He will serve another 4-year term.

title: Rich gay Catholic who fantasized about Islamists tried on appeal over terrorism charges
summary: Serge D. wanted to seduce Muslim men online but ended up encouraging them to join the jihad. Sentenced to three years' imprisonment, with two suspended, he was tried on appeal on Monday.

title: French mass rape trial: Experts dissect 'enigma' of defendant's 'split personality'
summary: On Monday, several experts appeared before the criminal court to analyse the background and 'split personality' of Dominique Pelicot, who is accused of having drugged his wife to rape her and have her raped in her sleep by strangers for almost 10 years.

title: 'People have never seen anything like it': Morocco hit by extraordinary torrential rains
summary: Rainfall on Friday and Saturday exceeded annual averages in several regions of the country, leaving at least 18 people dead, according to a provisional death toll.

title: Apple must pay €13 billion in back taxes, or EU's victory over tax optimization by multinationals
summary: After years of litigation, the European Court of Justice finally ruled in favor of the European Commission on Tuesday. Apple did benefit from illegal aid by transferring its profits back to Ireland, where they were barely taxed.

title: From chaos to enchantment, the night that changed the Paris 2024 Olympics
summary: The 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games got off to a bad start with sabotage on France's railway networks and bad weather. But in the course of one evening, the Games were transformed into a moment of collective elation that will go down in history.
